text: Pite z butelki. W aromacie bardzo fajne owoce tropikalne, cytryna, mango. W smaku bardzo podobne odczucia, goryczka niezalegająca średnio-wysoka. Świetna IPA!

Lively beer with some head. Aroma of tropical fruit, especially mango, resin, citrus, hops. Taste of hops, fruit, citrus, and even some notes of liquorice. Medium sweet and light bitterness. Very good beer.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget Nordstan, sampled on June 17, 2017. BB Z41117, which is odd... Batch 644.Cloudy lemon peel yellow color, medium big white lasting head with lacing. Sweet, caramel, hoppy, resin, bitter, citrus taste. Alcohol, bitter, resin, hoppy aftertaste. Warming alcohol. Medium full, also fizzy, mouthfeel. High dry bitterness.Nice, but too bitter really, also do not look very appealing. Could drink again, but not a lot or very often.7/3/7/4/14=3.5

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks. BB 19.10.2017. orange cloudy color, small white head. smells mango, passion fruit, light pines, lychee, some oats, lightly grassy. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, grapefruit zest, mango, passion fruit, bit grassy. finishes lightly bitter with notes of mango, citrus and light grapefruit. very nice one, great balance, looses a bit towards the finish, but overall very nice stuff.

Butelka. Aromat mocno owocowy, pomarańcze, mango, brzoskwinia, lekki ananas. Trochę drożdżowy.W smaku podobnie. Soczkowo owocowe. Głównie pomarańcza i mango z ananasem w tle. Goryczka średnio wysoka, trawiasta. Jest delikatny, przyjemny geraniol. Czepiłbym się lekko gryzącej goryczce.
Wygląd soku pomarańczowego, mega zmętnienie, żółta barwa, piana niezła. Bardzo ładny aromat, sporo mango, cytrusów. Piwo bardzo wytrawne, delikatna owocowa nuta. Goryczka niezła, niskie nasycenie.
0,3l bottle. Nose: at first huge canned pineapples, then some peppery notes and hop pellets. Taste: mango, pineapple, piny bitterness, slight hop burn

Pours yellow and hazy with a thin head. 
Apricot and peach aroma with very much the same tropical fruit cocktail in the taste. Very crushable; great stuff.

On tap at VCBF17, Belgium. 
Nose is citrus, grass. 
Body is clear pale, head is very big, creamy rocky, average lasting, excellent lacing. 
Aroma is corn, grass, grapefruit, honey. 
Medium sweet, medium bitter, light citric fruity sour. 
Finish is medium lasting hoppy citric medium bittersweet. 
Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Easy, refreshing summer beer, tasty, perfectly balanced, great one.

Keg at Bottle Shop. It pours Hazy bright gold with a small white head. The aroma is soft, sweet, juicy, fresh, creamy, peaches & cream, apricot, some green hops and spring onions. The taste is quite soft, sweet, restrained bitterness, juicy, apricot, peachy, brioche, green, grassy and a touch of alcohol. Medium body and soft carbonation. Well rounded and quaffable. Decent IPA, but not a world beater imo.

On tap at The Bottle Shop Bermondsey. Hazy orange gold colour lasting white head. Grapefruit and tropical fruit hop aroma. Good clean hoppy pale ale. Light bitterness on the finish. Good tropical fruit very hoppy.

W aromacie cała masa owoców tropikalnych, cytrusów, żywicy. W smaku przede grejfruty grają pierwsze skrzypce, delikatne mango/marakuja. Goryczka jest wręcz idealnie zaznaczona, nie zalega. Bardzo fajne piwo zdecydowanie.
Aromat troszkę cebulki na początku. Bardzo fajna tekstura i pełnia. Brakuje mi tutaj mniej zalegającej goryczki i większej ilości owoców
Bottle. Great aroma, intense and full of fruits. 5aste is medium bitter, bitterness is short and pleasant, dry but nicely full. Flavor of fresh and juicy grapefruits. Great beer.
Bottle from Park Fever, Hither Green. Hazy gold pour with a white head. Grapefruit, mango, apricot, peach and vanilla aroma which segues nicely into the flavour. Nice.
This beer is what youd expect from a neipa - low bitterness, juiciness, loads of fruits, dense, smooth mouthfeel and great drinkability.

Zółte, mętne. Piana ładna, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa. Świetny aromat, intensywny, zmienia się wraz z upływem czasu. Początkowo wychodzi nuta żywicy, dalej cytrusy, szczególnie mandarynka, pomarańcza, grejpfrut. Do tego owoce tropikalne, mango, ananas, żółte owoce. W smaku również bardzo owocowo, przyjemnie, gładko, nieco wodniście. Najpierw owoce, chwilę potem kontra ze strony goryczki. Na finiszu grejfrutowy posmak, goryczka krótka, nie zalega choć jest dosyć intensywna. Wysycenie średnie, odpowiednie. Bardzo przyjemnie się pije. Świetne piwo

Hazy orange, head disappears after while. Aroma: oranges, citrous, fresh hop. Medium to light body, medium sweetness. Juicy flavour, extremly fruity, but in hoppy way. Medium bitterness, greatly balanced. Session, but not empty.

33cl Bottle @ 32GreatPower, Seville, Spain.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head
Aroma is tropical fruits juice.
Taste is tropical fruits juice, citrus, slightly bitter.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Awesome NEIPA.

09-05-17 // bottle. Pours a hazy orange beer with a solid white head. Intense tropical fruity nose. Taste is pine, citrus, peach, grapefruit, more tropical fruits, slight floral. Dry and crisp bitter hop finish. Great beer!

Butelka z datą : 19 10 17
AROMAT : Bardzo intensywny. Jest tutaj wszystko: żółte owoce, cytrusy (grejpfrut). W tle nuta pieprzu ziołowego.
SMAK : Wytrawne. Poezja chmielowa. Cytrusy, owoce...szkoda wymieniać - trzeba pić! Goryczka wysoka, krótka. Ekstremalnie pijalne. Posmak grejpfruta oraz mango.
WYGLĄD : Barwa żółta, mętne. Piana średniej wysokości, krótka. 
OGÓLNIE : Dlaczego taka mała buteleczka? Ale to jest dobre!
Bottle at home! Hoppy full of aroma, light bitterness aggressive IPA,Medium body with soft carbonation.
[5/12/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Yellow session. Cloudy yellow. Fruity and oniony hops, a bit vegetal, dry, bitterish.

Bottle from Rickfifty, thanks a lot! Pours amber, a bit hazy. Small to medium, white head. Mango, pineapple, tropical fruit, caramel and some honey flavour. Bitter, a tiny bit harsh bitterness. Medium body. Medium to soft carbonation. A bit grainy. Good, but we tried this one right after a super fresh NEIPA, so maybe it seemed a bit less fresh and a bit more harsh than it really was.

Magically good fruity and sweetness in taste and smell. Perfectly balanced bitterness. Exquisite bitterness that fills the mouth forever. You get a real mouth orgasm of this beer. The enjoyment is total. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

0.33l bottle from #615 - homed from Kihoskh. Looks exactly like it should. A hazy cloudy deep golden orange colored one with a nice big lasting and quite hefty lacing just off-white head. It smells also just like its supposed to. Sweet dry and hefty hopped. Lots of tropical fruity elements. Peach, mango. Also a little caramelly sweetness. Yeah, really like it. Tastes wonderful. Super smooth, really balanced on the hop to sweetness ratio. Malty and thick. Tropical almost. Feels nice and oily in the mouth and its about average on the carbonation. Citrus peel bitter and freshness. So lightdrinkable. Almost finished the while bottle before Ive even had a chance to give it a proper rating. Not more to say, a really good one! 26.05.2017

W nosie fajnie i intensywnie. Masa tropików. Cytrusy, ananas i mango. Barwa mango, piany brak. Lacing zerowy. W smaku ciut gorzej. Bardziej w strone mango. Niezbyt intensywnie. Wodniste, rze?kie, pije si? szybko. Aksamitne. Generalnie dobre.

From tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy golden orange color with white to off white head. Hoppy and malty aroma, caramel, grassy, pine, citrusy fruity, some tropical fruit notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Disig gyllengul öl med ett ganska lätt, vitt skum. Doft och smak av persika, malt, grapefrukt och tallbarrstoner. Mycket grapefrukt i efterbeskan.
Bottle 330ml (BB 19.10.2017). Resin, very fresh with medium, resin bitterness, a bit astringent, a little bit aggressive ipa, light and drinkable.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 This thing looks like straight orange juice, they werent messing around about the "haze"... Full floral aroma and citrusy taste, grapefruit, orange, bit of mango, a fair punch of hop bitterness, refreshing to the end.

200 ml glass from tap. Appearance is an almost clear golden honeyed shade, with a frothy head of white foam. The aromas are overwhelming - citrusy tropical fruits like pineapple and mango and grapefruit abound, without a single dominant aroma, with muted floral notes. On the palate, it is a sweet juicebomb of tropical fruit, like the aromas. Some light bitterness in the finish to balance this off. Mouthfeel is solid and decent, with a medium body and an average level of carbonation carbonation. Wonderful!

Pite na bieda bottle sharingu. W zapachu bogato - cytrusy, owoce, ananas, mango, pomarańcza. W smaku podobnie. Wszystko fajnie zrównoważone, nic się nie dobija. Goryczka niezbyt mocna, zbalansowana. Mega pijalne, fajna NEIPA.

From a Swedish liquor store: pours aomewhat hazy... not quite like a NE IPA. Aroma is hefty fruit notes, but you can sense a veritable sharpness in there. Light to moderate bitterness. Plenty of fruitness. Quite good.
Butelka. Barwa złota, metna. Piana biała, szybko opada. Aromat mango, grejpfrut. Mega pijalne, owocowe. Goryczka średnia w punkt.

Finally I laid my hands on this modern classic. Aroma is subtle, fruity, tropical, but I missed the hop punch. Practically no bitterness. Taste is of orange juice, tropical fruits, a little bit of kerosene (tiny one). Finish is sweet and fruity. Very subtle beer, I get the idea, but I prefer my IPAs to punch me in the face with hop explosion. This is too delicate and too sweet for my taste.

Tap @Ølfestival 2017. Pours murky yellow with a small, staying creamy white head. Aroma has oats, wheat, peach, papaya, grapefruit. Medium carbonation, fine dry and fairly creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet oats and wheat, to the point of being actually sweet. Then comes an elegant, very soft bitterness. Some pine, light warming, dry and fairly bitter. It kinda has it all.

Tasty, not too fruity, palate could be a little bit more bitter... 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great IPA. Fresh, citrus, grapefruit tropical aroma. Well balanced bitterness, nice carbonation.
Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Colour is very cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, tropical fruit, pineapple, hops and malts. Little bit of harsh.
Pours cloudy golden, creamy head. Aroma is fruity, citrus, mango. Taste is light, milky, fruity, very balqnced.

Bottle bought from honestbrew.co.uk, being drunk in the garden on a nice summer day. WOW this is amazing IPA. Tastes like it smells. Could easily drink this all day. Has the most amazing smell when pour however Im not very good at telling you want sort of smell that is. Has to be one of the best IPAs Ive had in a long while, and I believe that there are some really good IPAs that are coming out of Scandinavia. I wish I could try a double IPA version of this.

Wygląd mógłby być bardziej "hazy" jak na obecne trendy, ale i tak prezentuje się zacnie. Super piana, przy delikatnym wysyceniu, jakie mu towarzyszy i maksymalnie efektowny lacing. Aromat mało intensywny, choć piję bardzo zimne i nie dałem mu się otworzyć. Smak jest genialny. Piwo owocowe, choć mało cytrusowo-kwaskowe, w żaden sposób nie mulące, w sam raz wytrawne, z niską i przyjemniutką goryczką. Średnio pełne, co pasuje przy IPA. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Pijalność ogromna. Znika ze szkła w mgnieniu oka. 22 zł za 0,3 l trochę boli, gdy nieznacznie gorsze Juicy Delight kosztuje u nas 9 zł za 0,5 l, ale wiadomo, koszta importowe, a chęć spróbowania ogromna... Życzyłbym sobie, by co drugie pale ale w Polsce stało na tak wysokim poziomie, to by nie trzeba sięgać po zagraniczne "ipki".

Tap at Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen. Poured a hazy straw colour with a thin broken white head. The aroma is rich tropical fruit, grassy nettle hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a crisp, slightly watery melon woody hop bitter palate and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Draft at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Damn juicy, very fruity, orange juice, tropical, grapefruit, mango. Taste lacks a bit compared to the aroma. Very tasty.
On tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy orange pour with an off-white head. Notes of tropical fruit, grapefruit, dank hops, hop funk. Damn good.

Bardzo intensywny Mosaic. Poza wszechobecnym mosaiciem jest trochę mango i brzoskwini. Goryczka delikatna, bardziej w stronę znikomej. Trochę zbyt mdłe, poza tym takie jaki ma być podręcznikowy New England. Jakoś szczególnie nie oczarowało, ale nie było też super świeże.

Thanks to Fux! Sampled draft @ Gollem. Hazy orange, creamy solid white head. Nose is lemon sorbet, mango peel, bright. Body is bit too doughy but still very nice mango peeel, hop flowers, orange, low pleasant cheesy mango in the finish. Body is delicious mango peel & dough. Another very nice Stigbergets beer.

Hazy yellow with a small white head. The aroma is just Mosaic awesomeness. Lots of fruits, earthiness, some pine. It has a medium body with a soft to medium carbonation. It has a creamy but also crisp mouthfeel. The balance of this beer is absolutely great. Its relatively dry and has just enough bitterness in the finish. Overall, I expected a bit more juiciness, but thats just a minor thing on an extremely high level.
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2017 Bottle from Bottle Baron. Hazy golden. Nose is grass, fruits, peach, pineapple. Tastes similar. Solid.
Riktigt riktigt bra IPA! Stor smak av fruktighet och perfekt bitter i eftersmaken. Kan verkligen rekommenderas!

Pours hazy golden. Very fruity. Peach, passion fruit, mango, pineapple. Soft, smooth, nicely balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,33 litre Bottle from Systembolaget Charlottenberg, at home. Cloudy with little head, not to bad.
Bottle from BrewDog Online. Cloudy yellow brown, good head. Resin hop aroma. Oaty hop flavour. Hoppy malty aftertaste. Very good but expected better.
Bottle. Pours hazy light gold. Aroma of mango, peach, pine and papaya. Smells wonderful. Big juicy taste with nice lingering bitter finish. This is a real top quality ipa, really enjoyable.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z Untappd w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Muddle mi bardziej smakowało z tego co pamietam

Nice looking - hazy, pale yellow color. Nice thick foam, not too big. Smells wonderful, so fruity and piney! Aroma has lots of pineapple, mango and a little bit of citrus. Taste is wonderful: perfectly pronounced taste of one of my favorite hops the mosaic - especially the bitterness bears its characteristics. Extremely tropical taste too with a warm bready and a little sweet maltyness which Im now starting to relate to Stigbergets. Dry finish. Lovely!!
Piwo złote, zmetnione. ana ładnie lepi szkło. W aromacie wyraźne owoce tropikalne, nafta - przyjemnie. W smaku lekka goryczka. Ładnie ułożone. Wysycenie niskie. Wytrawne.

Draft 0.15l at Craft & Draft Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 04.04.2017. Taste with kermis. Pour it hazy orange color with medium white head. Aroma orange juice, some candy bar. Taste lots of orange, citrus, tangerine, some grapefruit, resin, leaves, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, lively, astringent finish.

Troebel blond bier met witte schuimkraag. Geur: hoppig, fruitig, exotisch fruit, mango, licht zweterig. Smaak: licht hopbitter en lekker fruitig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitter. Lekker fruitige, aangenaam drinkbare en iets zachtere IPA.

Bottle from trade with Thomas, shared at Dans. Pours hazy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of hop, tropical and citrus fruit, touch of caramel. Moderate sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body, slight oily texture, soft carbonation. Good stuff.
En fantastisk grumlig profil. Bra fyllighet utan att vara extrem åt något håll.
Pours hazy orange with small head. Aroma: nice orange with a touch of spices. Taste: orange, but also an interesting fruity flavor, probably from the yeast. Medium bitter palate.
on tap oro velata buona schiuma persistente frutto passione buona intensita secca buon amaro non invasivo fruttata

Aroma is very very intense with grapefruit, ananas, mango, a bit turbid golden with a good white head quite persistant, light body, medium carbonation, taste is similar and very intese, not very bitter in the final...for geek or not this beer is very good, intense and balanced.

Cloudy yellow color with a fine white head. Ok lacing. Solid aroma! Medium (+) body and a smooth carbonation level. Mellow nice sweetness and a mild bitterness. Juicy mouth feeling. Nice balance between tropical fruits and citrus hoppy stuff. Also some pine there. Yummi![Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden]

W aromacie dużo owoców, ananas i melon, cytrusy, nafta - pięknie pachnie. W smaku NEIPA jak się patrzy, gładka, soczysta, znów melon i ananas, także nieco nafty. Niby już nie najświeższe, ale dalej robi dobrze.
On tap at hop north, pure juice bomb IPA, very easy to quaff, great fruit flavours
Przyjemne i gładkie, trafiło mi się jednak trochę jajka w aromacie, które po czasie uleciało, tak byłoby powyżej 4.o, bo piwo znakomite.
Aromat dosy? s?aby ale bardzo przyjemny. Du?o owoców, troch? granulatu chmielowego. Niska przyjemna goryczka, g?adkie. Bardzo dobre
Flaske. Gulaktig disig farge. Moderat karbonert med hvit tynn skumtopp. Smaker furunål,grapefrukt,ananas,gress. En utrolig god øl med mye frukt og lav bitterhet
Bottle shared with the bro. Pours a cloudy apple juice colour with a frothy a white that slowly fades. Amazing aromas of mango, peach and pine. Flavour is tropical, pine, and citrus. Delicious
Gyllent, tåkete med fint skum. Masse frukt både i duft og smak, mango, ananas og sitrus mest fremtredende. Også noe mint i smaken. Svak bitterhet.

6.5%ABV. IPA.

Poured out deeper gold. 7 SRM.

Nose has more pronounced malt with a slightly humid funk, like a fresh wheat or rye bread. Ripe citrus on the nose.

Mouthfeel is thick juicy, slightly sweet. Good carbonation. Hops are mango peel, pine, and that same sappy bitter finish. Nice spicy on fire front of the palate with good wild scallion, cilantro.

Finish is aromatic with citrus peel, some preserved mandarin peel.

Goes on Favorites List!

Bottle at Monterey, Berlin. Pours a clearish golden with a small white head. Sweet with a light dryness. Lots of floral hops aromas. Also notes of spruce. Hints of resin. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry, hoppy finish.
Bottle. Heavy hoppy. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, floral, earthy and notes of grass. Light malty backbone. Starts light sweet but finish heavy crisp bitter. Light and juicy. A nice one.
Murky orange with white head. Pineapple, weed, mango and lime. Dank, spicy, and fruity finish. Rough in a good way.

(bottle, 33cl) Cloudy, orange-golden colour with a short off-white foamy head. Fruity and spicy hoppy aroma with notes of citrus, cactus juice, also hay, hints of buttery malt and wheat in the background. Bitter and slightly sweet flavour, medium body with tame carbonation. Mildly buttery malty start with traces of caramel and drying fruity and mildly spicy hops tuning in; medium-dry juicy hoppy finish. Okay; perhaps something went wrong with the bottle capping. 27.III.17

Awesome fruity, citrusy aroma. White fruits, fresh orange, grapes - beautiful. Taste on the other hand is much more dry, but also super fruity. Delicate bittereness on medium level, long aftertaste. Very pleasant mouthfeel, super drinkable. Amazing IPA.
Love the mosaic smell. Hazy beer with minimal head. Good full taste and aftertaste.
Bottle from Lagerlager - murky orange color with small white head. taste is heavy on grapefruit, orange. nice malty body. finished dry and mildly bittler. very well balanced. great ipa.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2017 Drinked in a 10 days old bottle in Stockholm. Super hazy and Murky. At the nose is ace juice, orange carrot and lime juice. In mouth is full bodied, proper juice style. You can taste pallet hops on your throat but is very balanced and enjoyable beer. Marvellous beer

Bottle 0,33 @ Gambrinus, Tartu.
Golden color, hazy, nice head. Strong fruity aroma. Taste: citric, hoppy. Juicy. Well balanced.
Its just perfect. Unbelievable theres no fruits in it. Great juicy smell and taste just from hops. Enstrenght with some malty sweetness. Tropical juice. Awwsome!

Mooi oranjekleurig bier met compacte witte schuimkraag die langzaamaan inzakt. Mooi aroma van o.a. perzik, meloen, mango, exotisch, zelfs beetje room (lactose). Creamy, fruitig en zeer soepel in de mond met een mooie fruit-bittere (maar niet harsige) afdronk. Zeer zeer goeie ipa.

From Boxbeers. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 5x12-13. The haze isnt whats amazing here but the aroma and mouthfeel. The taste is excellent too, full of tropical fruits and citrus. One of those beers you start drinking it slowly at its end to avoid the end of the pleasure it provides

W nosie intensywnie, pełno owoców słodkie cytrusy, brzoskwinia, białe winogrona, melon, nuty kwiatowe. Barwa słomkowa, bardzo duże zmętnienie, piana średniej wysokości o drobnych ziarnach. W smaku soczkowe, bardzo owocowe, cytrusy, słodkie winogrona, ananas, brzoskwinia, trochę przyprawowe, w tle lekka trawiastość i nuty leśne. Goryczka średnia, grapefruitowa. Bardzo dobrze skrojone, tu wszystko do siebie pasuje, ekstremalnie pijalne. Butelka do 08.08.2017

330ml bottle from a bottleshare, thanks Peter A
Aroma of hops and nicely fruity melon, some pineapple and citrus. Amazing mouthfeel - full, slick, very tasty and smoothly drinkable

Draft at Craft & Draft. Hazy golden orange with an off white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, pineapple, citrus and light caramel malt. Flavour is light moderate sweet and above moderate bitter. Medium bodied with a juicy hop coating palate and soft carbonation.

Bottle. Amber color, hazy liquid, white head. Aroma of pineapple is dominant, with multiple other fruits in background. Well balanced in terms of bitterness and sweetness. Very good but a little bit "fancy".
Bottle. Hazy orange pour. Aroma of orange zest, citrus, caramel and pineapple. Taste has lots of tropical fruit, orange zest, soft caramel, citrus and pineapple. Very nice.

Bottle. Hazy orange, with low white head. Aroma rather tropical fruits than citrus. Some mango, passionfruit. Taste: semi-sweet with dry finish. Lot of fruits, mango, passionfruit, grapefruit. Medium bitterness. Palate: soft, low carbonation, smooth, juicy. Excellent.

From 0.33 L bottle: pours hazy, bright orange-golden coloured with a white head. Great hoppy aroma, intense fruity with mango and passion fruit, some lime, a bit like fruity ice cream. Taste follows the aroma with a medium bitterness, well balanced, light malty taste. Long, aromatic hoppy finish with a good bitterness. Slightly dry mouthfeel, medium body with soft to average carbonation. Great one!

Zapach intensywny, ananas, owoce tropikalne, cytrusy, trawa, nafta. Kolor pomarańczowy, mętne. Piana obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, lekki lacing. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, średnia pełnia, cytrusy, owoce tropikalne, trawa, sosna, żywica. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie.
Bottle. Lots of tropical fruits, some citrus and peach, has that Mosaic note. In taste very juicy with light body and very well balanced bitterness. Very drinkable and tasty.

330 mL bottle. Deep orange body. Medium white head. Smells of citrus, caramel malt, and diacetyl. Ugh. Tastes much the same. Orange. Candy sweetness. Butter. Medium body. Its not the worst diacetyl flavor, but it definitely ruins it.

On tap, @BierCab, Barcelona. 25/03/17
Color amarillo espuma blanca, aromas y sabores frutales, tropicales cuerpo medio, agradable.

330ml bottle. Amazingly hazy (actually pretty much opaque) orange colour with a small white head, retention ok, lacing good. Aroma is hoppy, tropical fruits, grass, sweet buttercream. Taste of sweet tropical fruits, grapefruit, mango, orange, pine, good hoppy bitterness at the end. Mouthfeel is good, bubbly carbonation, very drinkable. Fantastic IPA.

Poszczególne aspekty oceny może nie porywają. Aromat cytrusów z dominacją grejpfruta. W tle cytryna, brzoskwinia i chmiel. Ale jako całość piwo idealne.
W tym piwie wszystko gra. Aromat ze smakiem. Goryczka z pełnią. Cytrusy z tropikami. Piana z barwą. Znakomicie pijalnie i rześkie. Bez nadmiaru słodyczy w smaku. W punkt odfermentowane. Ani za słodkie , ani za wytrawne.

(bottle) ugly murky golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of salted popcorn and yeast, heavily sweaty, with some notes of green olives, camembert and resin. flavour is mostly the same, lots of resin, yeast and herbal hops, quite grassy, with a touch of almond milk and a light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Looks a bit strange, pours dark amber. Nose is apricot, watermelon, orange. Palate has some weird roux thing going on, still a bit fruity, decently bitter. Maybe this bottle has leaked, good, but should be better (?).

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 Rerate, fresher, citrus, Unripe pineapple, onion, a bit mealy. Bottle, milky yellow, low white head. Very tropical juice aroma. Full bodied, mealy chewy, bit too much flour, bechamel or roux finish.

Cloudy yellow with little white head. Aroma is fresh peach, gummy bears, bonbon, marmelade, biscuit. Taste is bitter chalk with lots of dust and bad something. Ugly chalk on the mouth. Still lots of fruity stuff. But the chalk ruined it a bit.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2017 Bottle. Hazy orange color with small soapy white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, peach, buttery. Taste is buttery, tropical fruits, milky yeasts, biscuity malt body. Silky mouthfeel. Good one, but the butteriness is a bit irritating. I found the West Coast IPA to be a bit better.Bottle, thanks konstifik! The first try of this beer was obviously a flawed bottle. This one is just like a sweaty hazy IPA needs to be: sweatsocks, tropical juice, wheat, yeasts. Sil,ky mouthfeel, super-drinkable. Excellent!
Pours a cloudy yellow/orange with small white head. Wow the aroma is all tropical fruit. Juicy! Taste is nice and bitter with plenty of the tropical flavour and hops. Tremendous IPA.

0,33 l bottle from Biervana 
cereal, citrus, spruce, Tropical fruits, golden, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Muy new england para mi gusto. No soy definitivamente fan del estilo, y no sé si era la intención, pero me resulta una receta muy plana, todo aromas cítricos y levemente herbales, poco más. Mucho mosaic y puede q amarillo, pero sin presencia de maltas en nariz y boca. Aburrida

Data ważności:  01.03.2017 
 Kolor:  Ciemnożółty, mętny. 
 Piana:  Okazała, bieluteńka jak śnieg, złożona z drobnym pęcherzyków powietrza. Buduje wysoki kilkucentymetrowy kopiec. Opada powoli do sporego kożuszka. 
Na ściankach szkła umiarkowane zdobienia. 
 Zapach:  W aromacie cała wesoła gromadka owoców cytrusowych (ananas, grejpfrut, mandarynki).
Na przeciw nim stają białe owoce: białe winogrona, agrest.
Całość dopieszcza Mosaicowa nafta.
Pod spodem odrobina żywicy.
Aromat jest intensywny i ekstremalnie przyjemny. 
 Smak:  W smaku bardzo wytrawne, gigantycznie owocowe, ale nie tak soczyste jak GBG Beer Week.
Całe kosze białych owoców (grejpfrut, ananas, białe winogrona, agrest).
Wyczuwalne też lekkie nuty białego wina.
W oddali nuty żywicy i drzew iglastych. 
Piwo jest tak nieprawdopodobnie gładkie i lekkie w odbiorze. Nie sposób nawet tego pojąć.
Goryczka jest ta delikatna, krótka, znika przed kolejnym łykiem.
Tekstura zwarta, zbita, gęsta, oleista.
Sesyjność jak stąd na Marsa! To jedno z tych IPA gdzie wylizujesz szkło do ostatniej kropeczki i spijasz każdy łyk z butelki.
GENIALNE! 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Jak dla mnie TOP3 Stigbergets, ale na miejscu 3. Pierwsze miejsce bezapelacyjnie GBG Beer Geek Week, drugie Api Lairepmi.
Piwo bije po oczach swoim blaskiem, miażdży swoją gładkością i lekkością odbioru.
Budzi podziw intensywnością białych owoców.
Takiej delikatnej goryczki, to ze świeczką trzeba szukać.
Super piwo!

Color amarillo anaranjado o naranja amarillento, muy turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Parece un zumo de piña. Carbonatación mínima. Textura acuosa. Aroma muy frutal y ácido: lima, limón, naranja (nada típico para una IPA). Sabor plano de narices: frutal (lima, limón, naranja), sin apenas amargor y con un postgusto herbal muy mínimo. O no está en las condiciones óptimas (fecha de consumo preferente: 8/8/17) o no sé a qué viene el hype. De aspecto y olor es una maravilla. En cuanto a sabor... menuda decepción. Si está embotellada en 2016 no lo comprendo. Si está embotellada en 2015 lo entiendo perfectamente y me sorprendería mucho debido al fuerte aroma que posee. Más bien será 2016.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 Butelka: Już w aromacie uderzają dojrzałe owoce tropikalne, głównie białe, jest chmielowo, na początku czuć naftę, po chwili ustępuje owocom. Przewija się tu marakuja, mango, brzoskwinie, winogrona, biały grejpfrut, pomarańcze, muśnięcie ananasa, szypiorku praktycznie nie ma (a jestem na niego wyczulony). W smaku jest soczyście, ale podbudowa słodowa dość skromna, co sugerowała słomkowa barwa, goryczka średnio-niska, krótka, w ustach zostaje lekki posmak albedo i troszkę owocowej słodyczy. Wysycenie co najwyżej średnie, na optymalnym poziomie, piwo jest niesamowicie pijalne. // Lane z kranu nieco gorsze, jest mniej nafty i winogron, dochodzi za to szczypiorek / zielona cebulka. Ocena wystawiona za wersję butelkową.

0.33 l bottle from Beergium, best before August 2017. Slightly (!) hazy, golden amber with a thin, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, very fruity and slightly grassy aroma of pineapple, lemon and some vanilla. Sweetish, slightly bitter, quite fruity and slightly grassy taste of pineapple, lemon, some gooseberry and a bit of vanilla, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly herbal-grassy finish. Medium body, smooth, slightly creamy and a bit effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice, but lacks a bit of the punch and freshness I expected.
0,33l bottle from Beergium. Pours light copper color with pretty small head. Aroma of orange, mango, malts, grapefruit, pine. Medium and quite bitter body, a bit dry.

330 ml bottle from Beergium, batch #600, bb 31/08/17.
Amber, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of apricot, orange juice, passion fruit, grapefruit, pine, dankness, biscuit.
Lovely taste, with similar aromas, but even juicier and with some more earthy notes.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes moderate bitter, fruity, juicy, piney, a bit earthy, a bit dank, a bit sweet.

Very tasty! Reminds me of orange juice, supported by tropical fruit notes, a piney and earthy spiciness and just enough malt body. Another incredibly quaffable hazy IPA by this brewery!

Pomarańczowa barwa, obfita piana. W aromacie owoce tropikalne - mango, papaja, ananas. W smaku owocowo, chmielowo, ogólnie bardzo przyjemnie. Wyraźna goryczka owocowa, jednak bardzo krótka i mega fajna. Kremowość, soczystość - kolejna świetna pozycja. Jakbym miał wybierać między Muddle a Amazing Haze to chyba nie potrafiłbym udzielić odpowiedzi. Dwie znakomite IPY.
How : bottle Appearance : hazy orange with a medium to small white head. Aroma : apples, floral, peach, citrus peel, mandarin, grass, some honey and herbs. Palate : medium body, average carbonation.

bardzo ladny aromat tropikow, troche cos w stylu ananasa z mango, w smaku jest wyczuwalna podstawa słodowa ale jest bardzo lekkie, goryczka dosyc konkretna ale nie zalegająca, troche za krotki aftertaste ale jako calosc bardzo dobre piwo

33 cl. bottle at home. Medium high fluffy white head. Hazy dark yellow body. Acidic grapefruit wheat aroma. A bit sharp fruity grapefruit pine flavor with a good deal of hops bitterness. High carbonation. Long dry and bitter finish.

Może trochę mniej "NEPIowa" niż GBG, ale trzyma wysoki poziom. Oczywiście neiprzejrzysta, wygląda jak sok. Aromat intensywnie tropikalny - mango, marakuja, trochę liczi. Smak dosyć intensywnie goryczkowy, jak na NEPIa, ale za to krótko. Ciało mogło by być trochę bardziej kremowe i aksamitne. Generalnie bdb piwo, wysoce pijalne, aromat owoców tropikalnych powala. Polecam.
Mógłbym pić wiadrami. Cudowny aromat żółtych owoców. Kremowa tekstura, totalnie czysty, chmielowy smak, z wyraźną, acz bardzo krótką i niesamowicie owocową goryczką. Znakomite piwo!

Aroma of fresh tropical fruits and citrus such as grapefruit, pomelo, passionfruit, lychee. Pours hazy orange with white head. Taste is medium dry, very juicy fruity with citrus and tropical fruits. Medium bitter finish, grapefruit-like. Average carbo, creamy mouthfeel. Overall briliant.
Bottle. Another good IPA from Stigberget, altough I find it a bit too sweet. Notes of orange cest, lime and caramel.

Rami Rami is drinking an Amazing Haze by Stigbergets Bryggeri at Chmielarnia Marszałkowska

Duzo mniej NE niz sie spodziewalem, pyszka ale muddle i gbg lepsiejsze. :) geraniol? I tak pycha

Bardzo ładna intensywnie pomarańczowa barwa. Piana biała, drobnopęcherzykowa. Bogaty aromat owoców tropikalnych: mango, marakuji, pomelo. W smaku na początku uderza słodycz owoców tropikalnych ale później jej poziom spada i piwo robi się nieco bardziej wytrawne. Dość wysokie nagazowanie. Goryczka owocowa, krótka i przyjemna.
Piña, pomelo, albahaca, eucalipto, pino. Cuerpo medio-alto y amargor resinoso largo.

Bottled (thanks hermod!). Hazy orangeish golden colour, medium sized white head. Aroma is floral, herbal and grassy notes. Flavour is herbal, fruity, floral, some herbal and some sweet malts. Really nicely balanced.

Bottled 330ml (thanks Hermod)
Hazy yellow color, good white head. Juicy aroma, lots of gooseberry bush in the aroma. Medium-bodied. Gooseberry hoppyness, juicy flavor. Nice refreshing crisp pale malty backbone. Nice.
Pours pale, very hazy, proper head. Amazing fruity aroma. Citrus, lychee, tropical fruits perfect. Stron bitterness, some sourness. Fruity aftertaste, avg carbonation. One of the best ever had.

A wonderful tropical hops smell. Looks like a hazy orange juice. A mind blowing fresh taste of a hopsy IPA. Very drinkable indeed, could have ten of these in a row. An absolutely amazing IPA; only their own GBG 2016 can beat this!

Mętne, ciemnozłote, piana przeciętna. W aromacie żywica, cytrusy, tropiki, trochę cebula, nafta - mosaic jest jednak charakterystyczny :) W smaku jest przede wszystkim soczyste, z bardzo fajną, cytrusową, świeżą goryczką, umiarkowaną (ale nie niską) jeśli chodzi o intensywność. W miarę ocieplania robi się lekko agresywne za sprawą nafty/cebuli. Średnio wytrawne. Bardzo pijalne.
Orange färgad grumlig med vit skum. Doftar och smakar mycket tropisk frukt. Fyllig med bra beska

Bottle. A murky, slightly orange beer, a head is almost medium and blond. Aroma has lots of tropical fruits, mangos, papaiyas, some grapefruits and fructose, slighlty messy. Taste has tropical and smooth fruitness, mangos, grapefruits, medium bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth palate. Lots of tropical fruits, but overally, slightly messy. Anyway, good beer.
Wysmienite swieze lekkie owocowe ale stosunek jakosci do ceny jefnak obniza note
Super rześka NEIPA, bardzo pijalna, ale umówmy się... W tej cenie to ja sobie mogę kupić ze 4 Misty z Trzech Kumpli i będzie to ten sam poziom ;)
Floraler Oatmealer mit sanfter Hoppyness und verspielter Hefigkeit. Der heuige Gleiter ins hemdsärmelige IPA Glück. A Nice Start. 0,33/5 Euro. Bottle. BEYOND BEER HH. Überbewertet...

330 mml bottle tasted on the 04/03/2017. Hazy pale golden colour with a medium off-white head that dissapears quickly. Aroma of intense tropical fruits and hops, very nice. Taste is medium sweet with a long citric fruity mouthfeel. Some caramel on the finish. Next one please!

Bottle at Pułapka, Gdańsk. Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits (pineapple, melon) with strong notes of green onion. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium- bitter, malt, tropical fruits, citrus, some onion (not as strong as in aroma). Medium body, fairly smooth texture, average carbonation. Very unpleasant onion in aroma - what a letdown. Still juicy and quite decent, but far from Gbg Beer Week 2016 level.
33cl bottle. hazy orange, pineapple, marmelade, citrus, hops, other tropical fruits. avg bitterness that lingers on for a while.
Tåkete lys brun med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter sitrus, appelsin, aprikos, noe epler og blomster. Middels fylde og bitterhet. Masse fruktighet kommer igjennom, sitrus og moden sydhavsfrukt.

Draught. Hazy pale yellow in color with a whitish head. Tropical fruits, citrus, some piney forresty notes and bit of sweetness in aroma. Feels quite juicy and nice. Sweetness and tropical fruityness in taste too, some mild grapefruity bitterness as well. Quite good drinkability, despite being very fruity and almost too sweet in aftertaste, the mild bitter notes saves and makes it quite nice though in the end.
High drinkable, true session beer, in aroma mostly resin and herbals plus citrus, in taste fruits.

Bottle from systembolaget 
Hazy gold n.
Tropical fruit. Quite bitter, slight sweet and round.

330ml bottle. Murky amber colur with average, frothy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Tropical fruity, hoppy aroma, notes of papaya, mango, passion fruit, some lemon, lemon zest, caramel malty background. Taste is bitter, citrusy and tropical fruity hoppy, slightly sweet, oaty and biscuity malty basis, notes of lemon, mango, passion fruit, papaya; lasting bitter and juicy, citrusy finish. Superb drinkability - excellent.

(Keg at Sori Taproom, 20170313) The beer poured orange and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, citricness and grapefruit. 330ml bottle thanks to Jashiu.
This the beer that I could drink every day. Its wonderfully fruity, citrus, melon, good looking, has perfect body. I love it

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2017 Pours straw like golden, cloudy with foamy white head with good lacing. Aroma: intense hop profile (single hop mosaic?) with piny, citrusy character, supported with gentle spicy, herbal notes. Flavor: hop notes are the same, supported with crisp, biscuit like malt notes. Hop bitterness is medium to high, finish slightly dry, bitter. Body is moderate to medium, texture juicy smooth, carbonation is moderate.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy orange pour with a slightly frothy white head, aroma has juicy pine and mango pulp, taste has biscuity malts, oily pine, some dankness, mango, taste didnt live up to the aroma, but a great beer.

Bottle at home. Pours, as the name suggests, very hazy. Pale, straw kind of colour, with a very fine sheet of head, carbonation seems to be rather low. Aroma is enormously rich and complex. There is some pine and resin, but not too much - very prominent are fruity and tropical aromas as well as grassy and herbal notes.
Spicy and complex on the palate, refreshing yet very complex in flavour. Citrus fruit, pine, tropical fruit combine eith the distinct grassy, herbal and earthy notes of Mosaic. The Malt is less pronounced but forms a light sweet base - all in all the beer is well balanced. Finishes rather long with a pine and herbal pronounced flavour. 
An amazing beer which showcases my favourite hops beautifully. Simply an amazing IPA. The big difference to the GBG 2016 is that this one showcases the Mosaic hops and thereby its distinct aromas and flavours. So if you like the combination of fruity notes and herbal/grassy/earthy that Mosaic provides, youll love this beer.

Bottle from systembolaget. 
Pours hazy golden. 
Sweet and hoppy brew, mango, pineapple and a little pine.
Cloudy orange, small white head. Aroma is loaded with tropical fruit, pine and caramel. Flavour has orange, grapefruit, pine, peach, light caramel. Sweet with light bitterness.

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget. Colourful orange with a white head. Mango, citrus, hops. Quite intense taste, with nice bitterness, sweetness. Medium body, medium carbonation, bitter finish. Very nice.

Tropical aroma with lots of mango, passion fruit and pineapple. Taste begins sweet but is soon overwhelmed by the bitterness. Maybe a bit too sweet but it is good that there is balance to the bitterness. A good IPA but from all the hype I had expected more.

Aroma: mango, passionfruit, citrus, spruce, floral
Taste: light bitter, mango, floral, citrus, cereal, spruce

Many thanks to Nisse666 for this bottle! Nice fresh intense floral nose. The beer starts slightly sweetish, the floralness is round and intense but not too deep. Fresh intense floral pine and resin, but not as intense or great as I expected. A nice and solid IPA, but I would give 80/100 in total.

Bardzo solidna IPA. Mętna, żółta, z wysoką, trwałą pianą. W aromacie solidne uderzenie chmielu - mango, marakuja. W smaku jest pół-wytrawnie. Słodowości praktycznie nie ma za to jest czysty owocowy (cytrusy) smak. Goryczka umiarkowana - dobrze wkomponowana w całość. Orzeźwiające i całkiem lekkie. Pyszne.
Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of mango, pine, gooseberry and orange. Taste is citrusy - orange and grapefruit and some tropical notes, Pineapple and mango. Nice bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2017 A 330ml bottle, batch 583, with a best before date of 17th July 2017. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku glass. It was a hazy darkish orange colour with a just over one finger white head with great retention and nice lacing. Aromas of strong tropical and citrus fruits. Mango, pineapple, apricot, grapefruit and orange rind. Taste begins with a blast of mango and pineapple sweetness balanced with grapefruit and orange rind bitterness, for some bittersweet goodness. A dry and long bitter finish. Dry, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, in my opinion, although not quite as good as GBG Beer Week 2016, this was another home run by Stigbergets. Its got the stunning aromas, and the wonderful juicy tropical and citrus flavours that I enjoy, on top of the nice lasting bitterness. Brilliant stuff.
Weicher, leicht karamellig hopfiger Antrunk. Milde Herbe, steigend würzig, moderat bitter. Sehr süffig grasig, frisch, etwas Orange. 11/11/10/10//11

Bottle@ Gambrinus, Tartu. Pours hazy orange with nice medium white sticky head. Aroma: full of fresh mosaic hops, pine, tropical fruits, resin, some sweetness,grassy, peaches. Taste: medium bitter, grassy, resin, pine, juicy, tropical fruits, citrus. Well balanced. Medium body. Bitter finish. Nice one.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours hazy deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, pineapple, mango, peach and grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long tropical fruity, grapefruit and piney finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Immediately when opened there was this sweet banana aroma coming from the bottle. Incredible tropical aroma when poured, lots of mango, orange, some lemon, little bit of pineapple. The tropical fruit really overshadows everything else (in a good way though!) but theres some pine, weed, bread and caramel there as well. Perfect medium+ sweetness and also just perfect medium bitterness. Perfect balance IMO.
On tap at Kaelderkold. hazy golden colour with white head. Fruit and tropical aroma. Sweet, peach, juice, fruit and tropical taste. Medium body.
Draft - Sticky Mandarin and mango. Cloudy gold with a nice white head. Much like the nose, fruity and juicy with a decent bitterness.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 (Bottle)Aroma:citrus fruits,mango juice,resin,pineapple.Appearance:ultra hazy yellow color,small white head.Taste:semi-dry,flavour of citrus fruits,tropic fruuts juice,mango,resin,bready malt and wheat,mango like finish,bitter aftertaste.Palate:medium body,chewy.mouthfeel although not as chewy as in GBG.Overall:Fuccck how the hell do they do that ? Another superb ipa from Stigbergets.
Flot grumset gylden IPA, med kort let skum. Duft af citrus og grape. Fin frugtig smag med afstemt humle.
Tap @ dunkbar. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Hops, fruity, citrus fruits. Nice bitter aftertaste.

from Au Trappiste - fully cloudy dark orange beer with a modest head retention; solid hoppy aroma of grapefruit and tangerines; clean and fair malt backbone; juicy and bitter, dry and long fruity hoppy finish - superb

Pours an extremely hazy orange color with medium white head. Very Mosaic forward, tons of tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, very juicy, with moderate sweet citrus fruits, tangerine, orange zest and blueberry, with slightly bubblegum. Taste follows the nose, medium to full mouthfeel, full of sweet tropical fruits, juicy mango, stone fruits, bubblegum and citrus. Awesome beer!

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 Super fresh bottle @home. Probably my favourite NE IPA. Nice colour and head. Aroma is citrus, grass, tropical fuits. Taste is awesome! Juicy hops, freshness and not too bitter. If I could one have one beer the rest of my life, this is probably the one I would choose!

27.02.2017, tap @ Rbabarrab:
Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, hazy. Aroma is fresh grassy, leafs, citrus peel, moss, lawn, light malts, hops, flowers, hay, pine needles, minerals, citrus, oatmeal. Taste is dry grassy, leafs, weeds, citrus peel, moss, lawn, hops, oatmeal, hay, flowers, sawdust, citrus, pine needles, bark. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry grassy mouthfeel. Nice.

Draught at Rbabarrab, Cph. Very hazy golden amber colour with a fluffy white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, floral hops, sweet exotic fruits, apricot, lightly toasted notes. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a soft, creamy texture. Finishes lasting dry and bitter with citrus fruits and exotic impressions. Excellent NE style IPA from Stigbergets.

Pours hazy yellow with a one finger high white head. Aroma; Pineapple juice, citrus, mandarin, grass, mango and floral notes. Taste; Pineapple, ggrapefruit, grass, citrus and floral with a nice bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale golden with a 2 finger white top. Nice aroma with tropical fruits, grass, citrus and pineapple. Taste is light bitter and fruity. Loads of hop-juice flavors.. Grass, citrus and pineapple. Finish is semi-dry with a lasting bitterness. This is good and highly drinkable! Medium body, avg co2.

Easily best IPa Ive ever tried and first NE Style for me. Extremely hazy, bears resemblance with pineapple juice. Lots of citrus juice, mandarin, orange, tangerine, tropical fruits and grass. Very juicy and flavourful.

33 cl bottle. Batch #583. BBE 17.07.2017. Thanks tiong!
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Aroma is fresh hoppy, pineapple, mango, mandarin, juicy overall. Flavor is juicy with mango, orange, lemon, resinous hops, subtle grassy tones. Quaffable, refreshing and juicy, very tasty.
4515

330 ml bottle. Pours a nice cloudy yellow colour with a small head. Aroma of juicy fruitiness, dank hoppiness and floral notes. Flavour of citrusy bitterness, dankness, fruitiness, floral notes and some mint notes. Medium bodied. Really soft carbonation. Good stuff, although could use a lot more bitterness in the finish. Now its just overly juicy.

33 cl bottle @ lusikka. Batch #583, BBE 17.07.2017
Aroma has tropical fruits and fruit juice. Flavour has fruit juice, tropical fruits, grapefruit and mild fruit candy tones. Lacks the hop kick in the finish, otherwise quite good.

Bottled. Amber coloured. Light hazy. Dense off white head. Aroma. Tropic fruits, flowers, sweetness, pine, citrus. Flavour. Tropical fruits, citrus, flowers, spice, herbs. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter and dry, somewhat citric. Fantastic brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Koht, Tallinn. Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is fruits, citrus, grass, pineapple, mango, some tropical sweetness, floral. Taste is tropical fruits, floral, some grass, grapefruit, pineapple. Very nice and fresh beer!

On tap at Koht, Tallinn. Hazy yellow to orange with a lasting, white head. Very fruity aroma, lots of tropical fruits, especially mango - almost a a tropical nectar. Moderate sweet with surprisingly fruity flavours, some acidity and a balanced bitterness. Surprisingly delicious!

330ml bottle. Pours hazy pale yellow, big white head stays, leaves lacing. Aroma is fruity, refreshing, sweet, hoppy, mango, grapefruity, melon. Taste is resinous, hoppy, bittersweet, buttery, lots of grapefruit, mango, tangerine. Tropical smoothie! Very well balanced, smooth carbo, medium to full body. Very enjoyable and refreshing!

Bottle : Hazy yellow colour, with a nice head. Aroma had a dusty, floral, citrus, dominans and a bit sweet maltynes. Flavor, had a complex mix of citrus, floral, mango organge mixed mouth feeling , medium body with a seet,citrus, biter citrus finish. Well done.

330ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy, bright yellow colour. Medium white head. Lots of different fruits in the aroma. Mango, pineapple, tangerines, oranges, grassy notes. Really juicy and refreshing aroma. Lots of different fruits in the taste as well. Oranges, pineapple, mango, tangerines, grapefruit. Amazingly goid mouthfeel. Really juicy, very well balanced beer. Absolutely fantastic.

18th February 2017Double Dry Hopped Mosaic IPA. Cloudy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light, dry and finely crisp. Sweet pale malts. A light and dry flinty mid. Spicy citrus and tropical fruits. Pine kicks in as does more hop spice. Dry finish leaves a minerally spicy fruity linger. Very nice.

Intense citrus fruits, lemon milkshake, passion fruit, juicy tangerine, dank hops. Hazy, pale gold, small, creamy, white head. Medium bitter. More citrus fruits, creamy lemon, bitter, unripe tropical fruits, passion fruit, very juicy, soft carbonation, medium bodied, pine. Very nice IPA, intense, complex, delicious. Bottle from Hop Locker, Waterloo.

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa in Rome-Italy. Misty orange pulp color, juicy appearance with a medium frothy white cap. Nose is an attack of fruit, yellow fruit, peach with highlights of grass. Tastes like ripped fruit, papaya. Body is medium and the finish is a bit resinous. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Tap (at koht). Pours hazy yellow. Aroma is hoppy, fruity, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, grapefruit, mango. Finish is grapefruit bitter. Feels rather mellow and juicy. Overall: good. Rating: 7:4:7:3:14=3.5
Bottle, BB 17.07.2017 (from UJH). Looks the same. Aroma and flavor are more intense, both have more hop kick. Prefer the bottle like with GBG. Bump +1 to overall.

Tap at Koht, Tallinn
Cloudy darkish yellow. Fruit cocktail aroma. Some wheatiness. Mango or at least fairly fleshy peach in the finish. An acceptable hop-oriented beer but certainly not amazing.
Tap. Hazy yellow beer, medium white head. Nose is citric hops, malt, mosaic, wheat notes. Flavor is malty, bready, fruity, citrus. Hoppy finish, more citrus. Nice and fresh.

Tap. Cloudy orange color. Small size, white head, stays. Fruity, citrus, oranges, sweetish, grapefruit in aroma. Fruity, mango, oranges, citrus in taste. Super fruity and citrusy in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Very well balanced. Fuckin excellent brew.
Tap @ Dunkbar, Odense. Pours muddy Golden with a White head. Tropical and sweet juicy Nose and flavor with a touch of yeast. Its tasty and satisfying but a tad too unrefined.
Juicy colour and pretty hazy. Smells really good of orange, grape, lemon and hop. The taste is long and dry but not to dry. The beer is well balanced. Really good!

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 On tap at Dunkbar. Muddy golden with a lasting white head. Tropical fruity aroma with pineapple, mango and honeydew melon. Sweet, juicy flavour with a very light bitterness. Very true to the east coast style, but I prefer GBG Beer Week with its more pronounced bitterness.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy yellow orange, nose is peach, papaya, cream, taste is sweet, chewy, fruity, juicy.

Bottle at home, 11/02/17.
Hazel orange golden with a well appointed light beige cap.
Nose is tangerines, melon, toasted bread, weeds, light dank hop, papaya. 
Taste comprises blood orange, red grapefruit, pine tingle, toasted brioche, cantaloupe melon, straw. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close peppered with semi dank hop bitterness.
Solid IPA but not a patch on the beer week 2016,  very surprised to see this as top 50 for style !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Not sure if this is better then the GBG Beer Week 2016 or not, but this is amaaazing!

(Draught at Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival, 8 Oct 2016) Golden amber colour, slightly hazy, with foamy off-white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with citrus, grapefruit and mandarin. Malty, fruity taste with notes of citrus, orange peel, mandarin, tropical fruit, some caramel and a balanced citric bitterness. Medium body, with a certain sweetness. Fresh and tasty, with lots of citrus and tropical fruit. Nice one.

November 2016 - 330ml bottle at home in Richmond as Stigbergets Amazing Haze, 6.5%, BB End April 2017. Vibrant fruit juice orange, hazy and opaque, foamy white head leaves dotted lacing. Aroma is breakfast juice, pink grapefruit, pineapple and a little HubbaBubba bubblegum. Body is smooth with tingly carbonation. Taste is juicy grapefruit and straw, a bit dank (but this may be accentuated by the oniony meal Im eating at the same time), more pineapple and tropical fruit juice with a hoppy bitter finish. An exceptional IPA. (4.1)

Bottle shared beneath the tracks. Pours lightly hazy orange-gold with a white froth topping. Great snout, juicy dankness, lots of fruity hops, citrus Medium sweet flavour, with moderate oily pine, mango, orange, papaya, pine resin. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Resinous on the finish, with plump citrus, light piney bitterness, more tropical aspect. Superb.

Bottle. Little Leeds Beer House. Super hazy, dark straw colour. Film of white head. Nose has a mineraly, lightly zesty, citrus vibe. Orange, lime and some melon notes. Soft, creamy malt backdrop. Taste is super juicy, lightly citric bitter. Clean and bright mouthfeel. This is like drinking breakfast fruit juice. Fresh, juicy finish. Stupid easy drinking.

Bottle. 6.5%. Best before 26.04.17. Pours a hazy/dense orange/amber with a light tan head. Good lacing. Fat aroma with juicy, citrusy notes. Same flavour, with a bit of tropical fruits thrown in. Quite bitter hop finish, the bitterness having a hint of liquorice to it. Lingering light apple note. Overall good. Not very complex, but well-made, with a nice hop profile. 03.02.17.

As the name says hazy, yellow with light pure white head. A strongly hoppy nose of citrus, other tropical fruit, dishwashing fluid and pine. Pine with hay, citrus and herbs. Fizzy carbonation, light to medium body and a slick texture with a long, bitter finish. A really nice IPA.

Keg at the bottle shop druid Street. A translucent golden orange with a fine white head. Aroma is citrus hop, vanilla, custard, bready grains, dank hop, tangerine. Hint of onion on the nose as well. Flavour is composed of raw bready grains, dank hop, juicy, tangerine, grassy citrus, grassy sticky hop. Palate is spicy hip, highish carbonation, grainy, crisp finish. Good.

Flaska. Batch #539. Oklar gul med ett vitt skum. Dofter av passionsfrukt, mango, ananas och citrus. Smakinslag av passionsfrukt, mango, tall och citrus. Stickig beska, som jag vanligtvis brukar ha svårt för men här funkar det utmärkt. Halvtorr munkänsla. Kvalitetsöl!

How: Bottle.
Where: Shared by rlgk.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, citrus, mango, pine, pineapple.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Tropical fruit, citrus, mango.

Keg Half Pint at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey, London in Nov 2016 - Murky Orange/Yellow in colour. Small off-white head. Very Fruity; bitter grapefruit citrus, rind, pith, juicy tropical fruits, peaches. Hoppy; dank piney resinous hops. Malty; pale malts. Bitter citrus and tropical fruity and resinous hoppy throughout Great depth of flavour. Good stuff. Punchy top quality IPA! (2016-11-26)

Bottle thanks to Chris! Pours hazy orange with a modest white head which soon recedes to a foamy layer. Aroma (tingles the nostrils as it pours) is pine, resin, mango and tropical fruit. Taste is mango sweet, grapefruit citrus bitter, orange sweet, med-high pine bitter, modest tropical fruit sweetness.

Bottle thanks to Ben! Pours cloudy gold orange, medium creamy white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, passionfruit, pine, pot. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, creamy and juicy. Medium body, silky mouthfeel. Excellent. Zezsty finish.
Tap.Hazy orange colour with off white head.Aroma is strong fruity with tropical taste exotic and nice dry with good long taste with good hoppy and long slight dry finish and overall nice.

Gyllengul och riktigt grumlig. Otroligt fruktig och fyllig. Väldigt god och bara slinker ner. Vackert!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle. Batch # 542.
Poured hazy golden color with a thick white head. 
Amazingly fruity aroma, lychee, pineapples, mango, zesty notes. 
Tropical fruits in every sip. Grapefruit, grapes, some pine. Again very nice body and superior drinkability. Wow.

30-DEC-2016, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Very hazy orange with a lasting, low, White head.
Extremely fruity. Exotic fruit, pineapple, grape fruit. A Little more bitterness than exptected from a NE-style IPA. Huge fruit, creamy, soft carbonation. Fantastic :-)

Just as labeled, this pours entirely turbid, with a nice golden-orange color and a froth, white medium sized head.

Offers an amazing, powerful nose consiting of juicy, ripe oranges, papaya jam, lime bonbons and luscious pineapple. Layers and layers of fruits, with a crisp lemon punch develop instantly the impression of summer with just a hint of toffee malts to balance the aromas.

Drinks light, crisp with a well accentuated sparkly carbonation, dryer than expected with a slightly warming, long lasting lemon finish.

Tastes of passion fruit sorbet, wrapped up by lime pulp, papaya and ripe blood oranges, establishing two things from the get go - an intriguing, sweeter fruitiness, and a prominent, crisp lemon bitterness. Lime prevails on the tongue till the very end, while the fruits get toned down onwards from the mid palate, replaced by toffee malts. Finishes clean and dry, with a big lime punch instead of the beers initial soft fruitiness, which lasts on the tongue for ages, wrestling down the malts successfully.

Awesome beer, extremely versatile on the tongue with a world class nose, which heads into the New England IPA direction, while its taste provides far more than a one-dimensional fruitiness.

I usually dislike IPAs because of their tendency to be singly bitter and this beer is an example of this. Thus my low rating. To be fair, my IPA loving mates really enjoy this beer so keep in mind when reading my review. Pours from bottle hazy yellow with tall white foamy head. Aroma sharp citrus. Taste bitter from start to finish. Palate slick.

Bottle. Unclear golden with a medium sized white head. Citrus, white bread and garlic like sharpness in the nose. The flavour follows with dominant citrus, heavy cheesy hops, hay, bread, mild sharpness. Medium body, mild sweet and firm bitterness. Dry and bitter finish. Ok, but a bit heavy.
Bottled:Hazy orange colour. Thick head. Hoppy aroma with pine needles, orange peels, shampoo and cookie dough. Really bitter taste of grape fruit, pine needles, lime and Seville orange.

Pour dark hazy yellow with white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, corn, spices, hops. The flavour is very good: corn, orange, grapefruit, pineapple, polenta for sure. Smooth and refreshing. Creamy mouthfeel. Amazing staff!

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av frisk grön humle, mango, ananas, passionsfrukt med toner av grapefrukt och citrus. Rena fruktiga och friska aromer. Bra balans, kraftfull kropp, fin jämn fruktig beska med toner av tall. Riktigt, riktigt gott!
Hazy golden of color with a white head. An aroma of exotic fruits, hops, lemon and dry. A flavor of grass, lemon, exotic fruits and dry.

Bottle. It pours hazy golden with a white head. The aroma is pineapple, pine, mango and oranges. Really juicy. Fresh pine, tropical fruity notes in the flavor. Oranges and gooseberry. Light passion fruit. Long fruity hoppy finish. Incredible IPA.

33cl bottle from a trade with omhper, many thanks. Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv grasig, fruchtig hopfig, trocken, sehr frisch. Geschmack sehr hopfig, grasig trocken, leicht fruchtig, sehr frisch, süffig, toll.

33cl bottle picked up at the Hop Locker. It pours a hazed golden color with a small white head. Aroma is big on dank and weed notes, melon and apricots. Taste is also rich in hop juice and dank, plenty of tropical fruit notes and weed. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very good

bottle, sampled quite a few times. Hazy orange, with a decent head. Nose of tropical fruits, some pine and grass. Mouthfeel is indulging, with a decent amount of bitterness and sublimely balanced. Mosaic hops all over. A stellar beer, a true IPA with a decent amount of bitterness that sometimes I miss nowadays since the NE style has become so prominent

Move over Treehouse and co, these Swedish kids have cracked the code. If you want a somelier-like review, skip to the next one, all I need to say is this is easily the best New England/Vermont/Hazy/whachoomakallit IPA Ive had and it beats any US produced oh so easily! Just hunt it down and have shitloads of it, because it is that good!

Bottled 330ml. -Courtesy of Marko, shared with him, franski and kajser27. Unclear Yellow coloured, minimal white head, again almost the same tropical nose as Beer Week 2016 had. The taste is almost the same but a bit sweeter than Beer Week 2016. Tropical fruits rulles again here. Again pleasant brew.
Pours cloudy yellow with a thin head. Aroma is amazing, just pure tropical fruit juice, pineapple, mango, papaya! A nice bitter beer with a hoppy finish.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As Stigbergets Amazing Haze ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, fruity malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, fruity hops, peach, light pineapple, sulfur notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, tropical fruit, hoppy, peach, pale malt, fruity malt, fruity, soft fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161210]
 8-3-8-4-16

Tap @ basement beer bar, Aalborg. Aroma of loads of juicy citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit hops. Cloudy yellow with white head, mostly lasting. Taste is light bitter and light+ sweet. So juicy. Medium+ body, oily thick feel and light bitter tropical finish.

Hazy bright yellow color with slightly off white head. Aroma is dank and tropical, really hoppy and chivey. Taste follows, really dank and juicy with fresh hoppy flavors. Medium body, quite smooth and well carbonated. Overall its a great New England style IPA.

330 ml bottle at home. Hazy deep golden with short white head. Aroma is big and hoppy, fruity mango and passion fruit, woody piney notes and some malt notes. Taste is very nicely balanced, beady malt with loads of fruity and piney hops. Fairly dry finish

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 6.5%. Unclear golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, tropical fruit and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grapefruit, citrus, orange, pine, tropical fruit, medium sweet and medium bitter.

Golden/yellow colour, very hazy, white lively foam.
Aroma; tropical fruits, mango, citrus.
Taste: Fruity, somewhat sweet, medium bitternes in the end. Quite thin mouthfeel.
Nice and refreshing IPA.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours cloudy dark yellow with a white head, lacings. Aroma of light malt, rich fruity hops, tropical fruit, peach, mango, pineapple, some sweet citrus. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, rich fruity hops, tropical fruits, sweet citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. Fresh and very easy to drink. 051216

ENORMOUS THANKS VIKTOR! Shared with kajser, ogivlado and franski! Lighly pearly fizziness in a misty yellow body and low white head. Huge dank aroma, slightly citric and sweetish, vague tropical fruit. So far very similar to the GBG Beer Week 2016. Lovely dank taste, light creamy mango, light citric note. Not that different from GBGBW, only slightly weaker and sweeter. Excellent, well rounded, great job.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit peachy tropical fruit flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.
Hazy golden, medium head, lasting laces. Mango and papaya aroma. Lots of tropical fruit in the taste, some grapefruit and a hint of licorice. Bitter but balanced. Very good.
Flaska från SB. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum. Fruktig doft med passionsfrukt, ananas och kryddig humle. Lättdrucken med bra balans mellan frukt och beska.

330ml bottle from Kihoskh. Batch 534, BBE 190417. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma of juicy tropical fruits, mango, passionfruit and citrus. Taste is juicy, tropical fruity and citrusy with loads of mango, grapefruit, passion and grass. Finish is hoppy, juicy and tropical fruity with some caramely maltiness, loads of mango, citrus, grapefruit and passion. Tasty NE style IPA.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 Pineapple, passionfruit, mango, pine, sweet, hop juice.
Cloudy golden colour, small white head, lacing.
Big bite, mid-sweet, hop juice, resinous, piney.
Medium body, creamy feel, average carbonation, bitter finish.
Well made.

Dimmig, citron gul, lätt färgat skum. Doft: Humle, humle, lite klassiska lacoste, söt gran doft, citron kola, frukt kolor, godis persikor. Smak: Humle, yellow label, fox citron kola, burk persikor, Loranga, barr. God, mjuk och len i munnen.

Bottle @ home. Vertical with Narangi. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet fruity with unripe mango, flowers, wheat, passion fruit and oranges, white bread. Medium body, sweet fruity taste with a balanced biterness, which is slightly banana peel astringent on the tongue. Flavors of pine apple, mango, fresh cut flowers, wheat, passion fruit, bread. quite assertive bitterness lingering.

Bottle. Had this side by side with Narangi. Pours a nice hazy unclear orange with a white head. Aroma is pure hop juice with those dank hops. Lots og sweet orange, stone fruits, grapefruit, weak pine, hop pallets, pineapple, tropical notes in general and some bread crust. Taste of grapefruit, mandarin, tangerine, tropical fruit, hop juice, bread crust, blood orange, pineapple, slight pine and with a very chuckable body. Oh man this is good!

Batch 542, best before 30/04/2017, aperta il 1º dicembre 2016.
Dorata chiara, "hazy", schiuma bianca di media persistenza.
Aroma di pompelmo, melone, mango, durian e camomilla.
Al palato sempre pompelmo, melone, mango e durian, finale amaricante dominato dal pompelmo con una lievissima punta di crosta di pane.
Juicy, non molto carbonata, corpo pieno, beverina con alcool ben nascosto.

From bottle. Amazingly hazy pours with a big white head. Aroma has lots of minty, tropical, super fresh hops. Orange, wheat, fluffy floral peach. Taste is smooth, sweet, light fruity citric like passion fruit. Medium bitterness and a fresh minty note leaves you happy and kissable. Fluffy carbonation and a light, crisp body. Nice.
Bottle @ home, from Systembolaget. Hazy yellow pour with a frothy head. Notes of juicy hops, citrus mangoes, stone fruit, light sweetness and a muted bitterness.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, peach, yeast, citrus, fruit, grapefruit and bitterness.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and light peachy. Bitter, fruity, slight floral. Dry and crisp hoppy. Citrusy and peachy finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget and sample at All In Beer Fest. Pours a very hazy yellow with white head with very good duration. Highly hoppy and tropical aroma with lychee, mango, citrus, a bit of pine needles and orange zest. Similar taste. Prime hop juice. Very similar to Narangi and Beer Week.

(330ml bottle from Systembolaget, batch 539) Pours extremely hazy, almost opaque medium orange with a smallish fine white head that hods a ring with lace. Aroma of mango, orange, grapefruit, blueberries, light but earthy pine, just a little bit of green onion in the background, a bit on the dank side overall. Flavour is tangerine, grapefruit, slightly underripe mango, blueberry, grass, dank, leafy and earthy undertone, a touch of green onion again, and floral passion fruit notes in the finish. Very lightly sweet pale malt core as support to the dank hop juice. Light to moderate bitterness in the finish. Medium full mouthfeel for style with rather light and tingling carbonation. The focus on Mosaic means the characteristics are highlighted well, but perhaps could use some counterpoint to the green onion touches. Very nice stuff though.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy orange color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, floral hops, mango, peach, resin, a bit of pine and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, floral hops, resin, a bit of pine and grass. Excellent IPA.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy pale and bright golden, medium size white head, good lacing. Big hoppy nose, citrus zesty, grapefruit, pine and resin. 330ml bottle. Hazy golden/yellow vody with a medium ehite head. Tons of sweet tropical fruits followed by a brief subtle bitterness. Sort of a fruit bowl.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

More golden lit haar than just haze, this super straw light opaque little number comes with a penetrating potetent bitter nose and is slightly sweet to start before powering in with those double dry hopped mosaic hops. Super long rumbling bitter end as well. Ripped and muscley without being grotesque or unbalanced.
A superb find.
Bottle from Boxbeers. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - citrus and peach. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 251116
Ljus grumlig med skum. Luktar fantastiskt. Somrigt och fruktigt. Inte så ruskigt besk heller. Men lite konstigt platt känsla. Rätt bra, men inte topp.

Bottle. Hazy yellowish with firm white head, lots of lacings, dissipates slowly. Atoma is fresh grass, orange, citrus, milk, sweet malt, zest. Taste is very fruity with oranges, citrus, apples, as well as bitter with hoppy notes, dry and bitter finish. Medium body, low to medium carbo. A good one.

Pours milky golden white low white head 
Aromas hoppy of citrus, grapefruit, passion fruit, mango 
Taste has notes of mango, grapefruit, citrus, resin, caramel, hints of lactose 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied, medium sweet, average carbonated, smooth bitter finish

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Bottles from Bottle Baron. Milky golden body with a medium white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of orange, mint and pine. Flavour of lime, peach yoghurt, grass and mango. Bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. A dank, delicious, uncomplicated IPA. Upped from a 4.4 to a 4.6 to a 4.7. This really is an outrageously good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 (33 cl bottle this time from Kihoskh; Batch #542; BBD is 30.04.17) This is exactly the same batch as the one I got from Systembolaget a month earlier so it shall be interesting to see how this beer develops after another month in the bottle. My personal attempt at an NE IPA surprisingly grew more bitter over time (just like a grumpy old man perhaps) To make the comparison as fair and scientific as possible this one was also poured at fridge temperature into a Rochefort goblet. The result is a cloudy golden body with one finger of white head that recedes a bit leaving the same film and nice lace as with the previous bottle. The aroma is more tart and citrusy than before but still very much fruitjuicy. It almost smells like there is a pinch of nutmeg in there but of course there isnt its just my nose making strange associations. Another association is actually Bret. The expression is less like fruit punch and more like citrus and a bit of resin or withered hops but still very pleasant and harmonic. Im assuming Stigbergets put a 6 month BBD on their bottles meaning this was brewed in October 30th 2016 making it two months old to the date of drinking. In the mouth the palate is similar to before and the flavour us similar in terms of the subdued bitterness but the aroma notes are again more citrus, resin, nutmeg and earthiness compared to the younger specimen. It has so far aged in a graceful way. Personally I prefer the fresher version, which is more directly gratifying but this one is certainly also enjoyable and perhaps a bit more autumn than summer in its expression.
ORIGINAL RATING FROM NOVEMBER 24th 2016 (A: 8; Ap: 4; Fl: 8; Pa: 4; O: 16)
(33 cl bottle from Systembolaget; Batch #542; BBD: 30.04.17) Poured at fridge temperature into a Rochefort goblet reveals a cloudy amber body with one finger of white head that fades somewhat leaving film and nice lace. Aroma is hopforward in a pure fruit juice way with notes of mango, peach and tropical fruits. Oily texture, solid mouthfeel, soft carbonation, medium body and sweet finish. Flavour has plenty of aroma notes and a very subdued bitterness making the beer very drinkable. The GBG Beer Week that I enjoyed last week was quite similar to this and its a bit difficult to discern the subtleties of the differences without having them side by side but perhaps this one has slightly less sweat and onion.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Didnt pour it all in at once since its unfiltered, pouring that in a bit later, so almost no head at all. 
Very hazy (duh) golden orange coloured beer. Like a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. 
Aroma is... just wow.. freshly squeezed orange and mango juice with a little bit of pineapple added, but also that lovely piney aroma. 
Taste is orange up front, mango in the middle and then grapefruit & piney bitterness at the back. As it warms up, the sweetness from the "fruits" shows up a lot more. Not as good as the aroma but still very good. 
A bit sticky in the mouth, extremely drinkable. 
I havent tried their GBG Beer Week so I cant compare but this is, to me, the IPA goal. 6,5 % ABV but still goes down way too fast, you just cant help to almost chug this one. If Stigberget made a DIPA version of this I think it would be my favorite one yet. 
So glad I bought 5 of these.

The aroma is full of hops, passionfruit, mango, pineapple, papaya, guava and oranges along with some mandarines. The color is reminiscent of orange juice. The taste is full of hops, passionfruit, mango, pineapple, papaya, guava, mandarines and oranges. Wow this is one incredible IPA. Stigbergets are absolutely killing it at the moment.I actually like this better than the GBG Beer Week which is blasphemous to say but this is just amazing. While the GBG Beer Week had some dankness this is so juicy and the good thing that this will be brewed regularly while GBG Beer Week will be not brewed anymore. Two amazing beers but this is more me.

The beer pours hazy, orange with a two finger high, white head. 

Nose: Tropical fruit, orange, lemon, mango, caramel malt, pineapple and honey. 
Taste: Fruity, juicy, fresh hops, orange, tropical fruit, mango, pine and grass. 
Mouth: Medium body and carbonation. Sweet and dry. Bitter ending. 

Fantastic!
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Cloudy golden, medium white head. Intense tropical fruit hop aroma, bready malt. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.

Flaska från SB. Rejält disig med lågt ljust skum. Fin fruktig doft med fruktkompott och tropisk frukt. Mjuk och frisk kropp (havre + vete). För utom frukt en hel del färska granskott och bra kådig beska. Befäster Stigbergets ställning som ett världsklasbryggeri på humlad öl. Riktigt gott.

330ml bottle. Hazy yellow with one finger white head. Hoppy aroma with plenty of mango, orange, sweet tropical fruit and a degree of dankness. Taste is hoppy and fruity with mango, orange, pineapple, tropical fruits and dank hops with minimal sweetness. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and fruity aftertaste.

Hazy (obviously) pale yellow color, small white head. Aromas of fresh pine needles, lemon, resin and cough drops. Balanced taste of sweet citrus, grapefruit, honey and resin with a bitter pine hops finish. Really good IPA.

Aroma is sweet and tropical with mangos and sweet pineapple up front. Taste is sweet and so juicy, but when compared to the GBG Beer, this one also carries a bit of hop bite. Easy drinking and just awesome.
Fad: Lysegul diset øl med et lille skumhoved. Superfrisk duft af humle, let citrus og i både smag og duft. Ikke så megen bitterhe. Vellavet moderne IPA.

330ml Bottle - Hazy golden/light amber. Grapefruit, cat piss, gooseberries and blueberries in the aroma. Fruity, hoppy and tangy taste with grapefruit, passion fruit, lychees and blueberries.
Bottle at home. Taste of citrus, zest, metal and green peppers. Dry hoppy aftertaste.

Pours hazy (surprise) pale yellow with a lasting white head. The nose is really fruity with a mix of pineapple, mango and apricots. Theres flowery yeast and only a light resinous touch. Taste is full with the same juicy flavour profile and a slight bitternes in the aftertaste and finish. Im sure I would have a hard time distinguishing between this and GBG if tasted blind.. except for the extra bitterness in the finish in this one. But otherwise every bit as good if you ask me.

On tap at Hagabion, Göteborg. Hazy (!) yellow with white head. Fruity, floral with citrus and lots of fruit juice. Semi dry with low to medium bitterness and medium carbonation. Really nice NE IPA, among the best in Sweden.
